Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: LKM File to Oracle (EXTERNAL TABLE) COMPONENT VERSION: 10.1.3.3 AUTHOR: Oracle COMPATIBILITY: ODI 10.1.3.5.0 and above
DESCRIPTION This LKM loads flat file data into Oracle by using Oracle external tables. Depending on column data types, data formats and KM options chosen, the KM may need to create a view on top of the external table to perform format conversions e.g. for dates.
REQUIREMENTS Source file must be accessible by Oracle instance. All mappings need to be executed on staging. For delimited files, all source fields need to be mapped. Date and Timestamp formats should be specified on source columns in the ODI COL_FORMAT field, if they do not match default database NLS settings. Please refer to Java Help for details on format syntax, e.g. "dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss" for Timestamp. Following date and timestamp format translations are supported: Java Oracle Note "y", "Y" // Year, supported: yyyy;yy => 1996;96 "MMMM(M)*" "MONTH" // Month, supported: MMMM => July "MMM" "MON" // Month, supported: MMM => JUL "M" "M" // Month, supported: MM;M => 07;7 "W" "W" // Week in month "w" "WW" // Week in year "DDD" "DDD" // Day in year "dd" "DD" // Day in month "a" "AM" // Am/pm marker "HH" "HH24" // Hour in day (0-23) "KK" "HH12" // Hour in day (0-11) "mm" "MI" // Minute in hour "SSSSSS" "FF6" // Millisecond in second "SSSSS" "FF5" // Millisecond in second "SSSS" "FF4" // Millisecond in second "SSS" "FF3" // Millisecond in second "SS" "FF2" // Millisecond in second "S" "FF1" // Millisecond in second "ss" "SS" // Second in minute "Z" "TZH:TZM" // Timezone, supported: Z => +02:00
BASIC CONFIGURATION 1. Specify the logical format for NUMERIC and DATE columns, if the format does not match database nls settings. 2. Set NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE, if your dates contain language specific elements such as month names and the database language does not match these. Note: select * from nls_database_parameters returns nls settings of database. 3. Set NLS_NUMERIC_CHARACTERS, if your file number format does not match the database default settings.
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - DELETE_TEMPORARY_OBJECTS: Delete temp objects after integration phase - EXT_MISSING_FIELD: Empty Fields are set to NULL - EXT_CHARACTERSET: Character set used for loading - EXT_STRING_SIZE: Length for character strings in byte - EXT_REJECT_LIMIT: Max number of errors for Loader - EXT_PARALLEL: Load using the parallel option - VALIDATE: Validate use of the KM - NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE: Language of date/timestamp elements - NLS_NUMERIC_CHARACTERS: Override database NLS_NUMERIC_CHARACTERS setting
LIMITATIONS Only file technology data types NUMERIC, DATE (including TIMESTAMP) and CHAR are supported. For Timestamps with time zones TZ will be truncated. For loading TS with TZ, please specify source column as STRING and apply the appropriate String to TS with TZ transformation, e.g. TO_TIMESTAMP_TZ(ALIAS.COL, 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS TZH:TZM')
Set this option to NO to retain temporary objects (files and scripts) after integration. Useful for debugging.
Empty Fields are set to NULL
'Missing field values are null' indicates that fields are set to NULL, if fields have not been filled with values.
Load using the character set option. Examples: CHARACTERSET 'WE8ISO8859P1' CHARACTERSET 'WE8EBCDIC500'
Length for character strings in byt

The STRING SIZES ARE IN clause is used to indicate whether the lengths specified for character strings are in bytes or characters. Examples:: STRING SIZES ARE IN CHARACTERS STRING SIZES ARE IN 2 BYTES
Max number of errors for Loader
Enter the maximum number of errors allowed in the file. Examples: UNLIMITED to except all errors. Integer value (10 to allow 10 rejections)
Set this value to PARALLEL to use the Oracle parallel load (faster).

This option generates an extra validation step during development. Validations performed are: - Test of mapping location. (Mappings need to be executed on staging)
This option should be turned off for all production use in particular for high-frequency execution. There is not added value in production, only processing overhead.

When loading timestamp data containing language specific elements such as the name of a month, this options specifies the language. Valid values are e.g. ENGLISH, FRENCH.
If left blank, the default client setting of executing agent process is used.
Please refer to Oracle Database Globalization Support Guide National Language Support Guide, Appendix A Locale Data, Languages for more details.

If set to blank, NLS_NUMERIC_CHARACTERS setting of database defines decimal separator for loading numeric values using external tables.
Otherwise the NLS_NUMERIC_CHARACTERS defined here are used for loading numeric values. This option is a two-character string. The first character defines the decimal separator and the second character defines the grouping character.
Note: Setting NLS_NUMERIC_CHARACTERS to anything else then the default, results in an additional view layer with appropriate SQL expressions.
create or replace directory dat_dir AS '<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[SCHEMA]", "", "")%>'

<? // We need to recalculate the need of a view, in case we had more than one file source sets using this very KM.
// Calculate, whether we need a view on top of external table extTabColFormat.setUseView( false ); ?><%=odiRef.getColList("", "<? if (extTabColFormat.requiresView(\u0022[SOURCE_DT]\u0022,\u0022[COL_FORMAT]\u0022)) { "+ "extTabColFormat.setUseView( true ); "+ "}; ?>", "", "", "")
%><? // Do we need a view on top of external table? if (extTabColFormat.getUseView()) { ?> drop view <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%> <?} else {?> -- No view required <?};?>
Grant dir access to work schema
<? // Do we need a view on top of external table? if (extTabColFormat.getUseView()) { ?> grant read on directory dat_dir to <%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_WORK_SCHEMA")%> <?};?>

createTblCmd = r""" create table <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%><?=(extTabColFormat.getUseView())?"_ET":""?> ( <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[CX_COL_NAME]\t"+ "<?=extTabColFormat.getExtTabDataType(\u0022[CX_COL_NAME]\u0022,\u0022[SOURCE_DT]\u0022, \u0022[DEST_WRI_DT]\u0022, \u0022[COL_FORMAT]\u0022, \u0022[BYTES]\u0022, \u0022[LONGC]\u0022, \u0022[SCALE]\u0022)?>" , ",\n\t", "","")%> ) ORGANIZATION EXTERNAL ( TYPE ORACLE_LOADER DEFAULT DIRECTORY dat_dir ACCESS PARAMETERS ( RECORDS DELIMITED BY 0x'<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("[FILE_SEP_ROW]","")%>' <%=odiRef.getUserExit("EXT_CHARACTERSET")%> <%=odiRef.getUserExit("EXT_STRING_SIZE")%> BADFILE '<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[RES_NAME]", "", "")%>_%a.bad' LOGFILE '<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[RES_NAME]", "", "")%>_%a.log' DISCARDFILE '<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[RES_NAME]", "", "")%>_%a.dsc' SKIP <%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_FIRST_ROW]", "", "")%> <% if (odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_FORMAT]", "", "").equals("F")) {%> FIELDS <%=odiRef.getUserExit("EXT_MISSING_FIELD")%> ( <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[CX_COL_NAME]\tPOSITION([FILE_POS]:[FILE_END_POS])\t"+ "<?=extTabColFormat.getExtTabFormat(\u0022[CX_COL_NAME]\u0022,\u0022[SOURCE_DT]\u0022, \u0022DEST_WRI_DT\u0022, \u0022[COL_FORMAT]\u0022, \u0022[BYTES]\u0022, \u0022[LONGC]\u0022, \u0022[SCALE]\u0022)?>" , ",\n\t\t\t", "","")%> ) ) <%} else {%> FIELDS TERMINATED BY '<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[SFILE_SEP_FIELD]", "", "")%>' <% if(odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_ENC_FIELD]", "", "").equals("")){%> <%} else {%>OPTIONALLY ENCLOSED BY '<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_ENC_FIELD]", "", "").substring(0,1)%>' AND '<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_ENC_FIELD]", "", "").substring(1,2)%>' <%}%> <%=odiRef.getUserExit("EXT_MISSING_FIELD")%> ( <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[CX_COL_NAME]\t"+ "<?=extTabColFormat.getExtTabFormat(\u0022[CX_COL_NAME]\u0022,\u0022[SOURCE_DT]\u0022, \u0022DEST_WRI_DT\u0022, \u0022[COL_FORMAT]\u0022, \u0022[BYTES]\u0022, \u0022[LONGC]\u0022, \u0022[SCALE]\u0022)?>" , ",\n\t\t\t", "","")%> ) ) <%}%> LOCATION (<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "'[RES_NAME]'", "", "")%>) ) <%=odiRef.getUserExit("EXT_PARALLEL")%> REJECT LIMIT <%=odiRef.getUserExit("EXT_REJECT_LIMIT")%> """
# Create the statement myStmt = myCon.createStatement()
# Execute the trigger creation myStmt.execute(createTblCmd)
myStmt.close() myStmt = None
# Commit, just in case myCon.commit()

<? // Do we need a view on top of external table? if (extTabColFormat.getUseView()) { ?> create or replace view <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%> as select <%=odiRef.getColList("", "<?=extTabColFormat.getViewExpression("+ "\u0022[CX_COL_NAME]\u0022,"+ "\u0022[SOURCE_DT]\u0022,"+ "\u0022[DEST_WRI_DT]\u0022,"+ "\u0022[COL_FORMAT]\u0022, "+ "\u0022[BYTES]\u0022, "+ "\u0022[LONGC]\u0022, "+ "\u0022[SCALE]\u0022 ) "+ "?>\t[CX_COL_NAME]" , ",\n\t", "","")%> from <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%>_ET <?} else {?> -- No view required <?};?>

<?
int ODIKM_errorsFound = 0;

/***********************************************/
/* For fixed length files: Check mappings done on staging */
/***********************************************/
int ODIKM_filePosMissing=0;
?><%=odiRef.getColList("", "<? if (\u0022[FILE_POS]\u0022.length()==0) {ODIKM_filePosMissing=1;}; ?>", "", "", "")
%><?
/* for fixed length file: any mapping done on source? */
if (ODIKM_filePosMissing==1 && "<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_FORMAT]", ", ", "")%>".equals("F") ) {
    out.print( "raise '\nMapping NOT allowed on source!' ");
    ODIKM_errorsFound++;
};

/**********************************************/
/* For delimited files: Check that source columns starting from the first one are mapped. No gaps allowed. Mapping on staging */
/**********************************************/
int ODIKM_colCounter=1;
int ODIKM_invalidMapping=0;
<%=odiRef.getColList("", "if (ODIKM_colCounter!=[POS]) { ODIKM_invalidMapping = 1; };\n", "ODIKM_colCounter++;\n", "", "")%>
if (ODIKM_invalidMapping==1 && "D".equals("D") ) { 
    out.print( "raise '\nFor delimited files all source columns between the first in file and the last mapped, need to be mapped on staging! No gaps allowed.' " ); 
    ODIKM_errorsFound++; 
}; 

/* In case no errors were found, display message in log */
if (ODIKM_errorsFound==0) {
    out.print( "# No errors detected" );
};

?>
